MASTER_PAD_VERSION_INFO.MASTER_PAD_INFO: Portable Application Description, or PAD for short, is a data set that is used by shareware authors to disseminate information to anyone interested in their software products. To find out more go to http://pad.asp-software.org

Program_Info.Program_Change_Info: Added new feature: Secure connections via SSL/TLS and FTPS tunneling
Program_Info.Program_System_Requirements: Less than 15Mb of free disc space.

English.Keywords: http tunnel, bypass firewall, secure tunnel, https tunnel, port forwarding, port mapper, port mapping, forward ports, proxy cascade, tcp connection forward, ftp, ftps, ftp tunnel, ftps tunnel, ftp redirect, ftps redirect, ftp forward, ssl, tls
English.Char_Desc_80: Powerful application that helps you to redirect and convert data.
English.Char_Desc_250: TunnelEx is software designed to redirect TCP, UDP, FTP and others, bypass firewalls and any restrictions imposed by the local security policy.
English.Char_Desc_450: TunnelEx is software designed to redirect data removing all the obstacles that can be thrown in its way, bypass firewalls and any restrictions imposed by the local security policy. TunnelEx possesses a unique combination of features that support different data transfer protocols and allow integrating them. Among them there are most frequently used TCP, UDP, UPnP, FTP, named pipes and others.
English.Char_Desc_2000:
TunnelEx is software designed to redirect data removing all the obstacles that can be thrown in its way, bypass firewalls and any restrictions imposed by the local security policy. TunnelEx possesses a unique combination of features that support different data transfer protocols and allow integrating them. Among them there are most frequently used TCP, UDP, UPnP, FTP, named pipes and others.
Due to the availability of the Pathfinder feature it becomes even easier to use the program because it can automatically ask for a list of free public HTTP servers and build a tunnel through them, however when necessary users can identify a list of preferable servers.
In case a local security policy denies you an access to FTP servers the program can redirect data through HTTP proxy-servers because it provides FTP over HTTP.
It may seem that it is rather complicated to use this program but it operates automatically to such an extent that users can fully rely on it. They will not know that TunnelEx plays an intermediary role taking functions of the real FTP and HTTP servers.
This version also features HTTP tunneling from a proxy cascade ensuring that client applications from different networks will always be able to communicate with each other.
All these sophisticated functions are of particular interest for IT-programmers, system administrators and other IT-specialists but thanks to its friendly user interface the program can be useful for home-users as well.
